intro: Sapium annuum var. bidentatum, commonly known as the two-toothed Chinese lantern, is a herbaceous plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated, orange-red蒴果 that resemble small lanterns. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a short, fibrous root system. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The sap of this plant is toxic and can cause skin irritation, so caution is advised when handling it.
